Singh","details":"Store, calculate, collect and transefer stakes and rewards to end user","methods":{"addPool(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"This function will create new pool, access type is onlyOwner","params":{"_APY":"APY percentage * 1000 for this pool.","_reward":"Staking reward token address for this pool","_token":"Staking token address for this pool. "}},"addRewardToPool(uint256,uint256)":{"details":"This funciton allows owner to add more reward amount to  this contract.","params":{"_poolId":"pool's Id in which you want to add this reward.","amount":"amount to be transfered from owner's wallet to this contract."}},"calculateReward(uint256,address)":{"details":"This function is used to calculate Total reward for stakeHolder for pool","params":{"_poolId":"The pool for which we want to calculate reward.","_stakeHolder":"The address of stakeHolder to calculate Total reward "},"return":"reward total reward "},"claimReward(uint256)":{"details":"Calculate the current reward, add with previous reward, Transefer it to sender and update reward to 0","params":{"_poolId":"Pool from which user want to claim the reward."}},"getStakers(uint256)":{"details":"Returns array of stakeholder","params":{"_poolId":"The pool for which you want to get list of stakeHolders."},"return":"stakers.array the list os stakeholders"},"haveSuffecientFundsForReward(uint256)":{"details":"Function to check if contract have suffecient reward allowance or not","params":{"_poolId":"The pool for which you want to check reward availibility"},"return":"True if have sufficient allowance for paying all the rewards"},"isOwner()":{"details":"Returns true if the caller is the current owner."},"owner()":{"details":"Returns the address of the current owner."},"poolLength()":{"details":"This funtion will return the length of pools\\ which will be used to loop and get pool details.","return":"Length of pool."},"renounceOwnership()":{"details":"Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.     * NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner."},"stake(uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Allows user to stake the amount the pool. Calculate the old reward\\ and updates the reward, staked amount and current APY.","params":{"_poolId":"The pool in which user wants to stake.","amount":"The amount user wants to add into his stake."}},"totalReward(uint256)":{"details":"Calculate and return total undelivered rewards till now.","params":{"_poolId":"The pool for which you want to calculate total reward."},"return":"_totalReward Total unclaimed reward till now."},"transferOwnership(address)":{"details":"Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner."},"unstake(uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Sum the unstakable amount delete and transfer the request to _stakeHolder","params":{"_poolId":"The pool in which user wants to unstake.","amount":"The amount user wants to add into his stake"}},"updateAPY(uint256,uint256)":{"details":"This function allows owner to update APY for specific pool.","params":{"_APY":"New APY percentage * 1000.","_poolId":"pool's Id in which you want to update the APY."}}},"title":"Staking contract"},"userdoc":{"methods":{"addPool(address,address,uint256)":{"notice":"This Function will create new pool with the token address,\\ reward address and the APY percentage."},"addRewardToPool(uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Let's you allot more reward fund in this contract."},"claimReward(uint256)":{"notice":"This function will transfer the reward earned till now."},"getStakers(uint256)":{"notice":"This function will give list of stakers who have staked any amount."},"haveSuffecientFundsForReward(uint256)":{"notice":"This function will return if it has sufficient fund for paying the reward"},"init()":{"notice":"This method will be called once only by proxy contract to init."},"poolLength()":{"notice":"Get the length of pools and use it to loop for index."},"stake(uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"This function will update your staked amount."},"totalReward(uint256)":{"notice":"This function will give you total of unclaimed rewards till now."},"unstake(uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"This function will transfer the unstable amount to your wallet"},"updateAPY(uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Let's you update the APY for this pool if you're current owner."}},"notice":"This contract will store and manage staking at APY defined by owner"}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"project:/contracts/Staking.sol":"Staking"},"evmVersion":"byzantium","libraries":{},"optimizer":{"enabled":false,"runs":200},"remappings":[]},"sources":{"project:/contracts/Staking.sol":{"keccak256":"0xb2f3b4f441a2898ce4678a3b0208cfba61f17ab2a77dc75b7e261fb7eca57163","urls":["bzzr://7cd4db36d73bc96e94a8b06a7110b71a2ab7090ce993b4c7a2a50c2e832bc6d8"]}},"version":1}

nodes.documentation:
@dev Wrappers over Solidity's arithmetic operations with added overflow
checks.
 * Arithmetic operations in Solidity wrap on overflow. This can easily result
in bugs, because programmers usually assume that an overflow raises an
error, which is the standard behavior in high level programming languages.
`SafeMath` restores this intuition by reverting the transaction when an
operation overflows.
 * Using this library instead of the unchecked operations eliminates an entire
class of bugs, so it's recommended to use it always.
nodes.name: SafeMath

nodes.documentation:
@dev Returns the addition of two unsigned integers, reverting on
overflow.
     * Counterpart to Solidity's `+` operator.
     * Requirements:
- Addition cannot overflow.
nodes.name: add

nodes.documentation:
@dev Returns the subtraction of two unsigned integers, reverting on
overflow (when the result is negative).
     * Counterpart to Solidity's `-` operator.
     * Requirements:
- Subtraction cannot overflow.
nodes.name: sub

nodes.documentation:
@dev Returns the subtraction of two unsigned integers, reverting with custom message on
overflow (when the result is negative).
     * Counterpart to Solidity's `-` operator.
     * Requirements:
- Subtraction cannot overflow.
     * _Available since v2.4.0._
nodes.name: sub

nodes.documentation:
@dev Returns the multiplication of two unsigned integers, reverting on
overflow.
     * Counterpart to Solidity's `*` operator.
     * Requirements:
- Multiplication cannot overflow.
nodes.name: mul

nodes.documentation:
@dev Returns the integer division of two unsigned integers. Reverts on
division by zero. The result is rounded towards zero.
     * Counterpart to Solidity's `/` operator. Note: this function uses a
`revert` opcode (which leaves remaining gas untouched) while Solidity
uses an invalid opcode to revert (consuming all remaining gas).
     * Requirements:
- The divisor cannot be zero.
nodes.name: div

nodes.documentation:
@dev Returns the integer division of two unsigned integers. Reverts with custom message on
division by zero. The result is rounded towards zero.
     * Counterpart to Solidity's `/` operator. Note: this function uses a
`revert` opcode (which leaves remaining gas untouched) while Solidity
uses an invalid opcode to revert (consuming all remaining gas).
     * Requirements:
- The divisor cannot be zero.
     * _Available since v2.4.0._
nodes.name: div

nodes.documentation:
@dev Returns the remainder of dividing two unsigned integers. (unsigned integer modulo),
Reverts when dividing by zero.
     * Counterpart to Solidity's `%` operator. This function uses a `revert`
opcode (which leaves remaining gas untouched) while Solidity uses an
invalid opcode to revert (consuming all remaining gas).
     * Requirements:
- The divisor cannot be zero.
nodes.name: mod

nodes.documentation:
@dev Returns the remainder of dividing two unsigned integers. (unsigned integer modulo),
Reverts with custom message when dividing by zero.
     * Counterpart to Solidity's `%` operator. This function uses a `revert`
opcode (which leaves remaining gas untouched) while Solidity uses an
invalid opcode to revert (consuming all remaining gas).
     * Requirements:
- The divisor cannot be zero.
     * _Available since v2.4.0._
nodes.name: mod

nodes.documentation:
@dev Contract module which provides a basic access control mechanism, where
there is an account (an owner) that can be granted exclusive access to
specific functions.
 * This module is used through inheritance. It will make available the modifier
`onlyOwner`, which can be applied to your functions to restrict their use to
the owner.
nodes.name: Ownable

nodes.documentation: @dev Returns the address of the current owner.
nodes.name: owner

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Ownable: caller is not the owner"

arguments.value: Ownable: caller is not the owner

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Ownable: caller is not the owner"

nodes.documentation: @dev Throws if called by any account other than the owner.
nodes.name: onlyOwner

nodes.documentation: @dev Returns true if the caller is the current owner.
nodes.name: isOwner

nodes.documentation:
@dev Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call
`onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.
     * NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner,
thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.
nodes.name: renounceOwnership

nodes.documentation:
@dev Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`).
Can only be called by the current owner.
nodes.name: transferOwnership

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Ownable: new owner is the zero address"

arguments.value: Ownable: new owner is the zero address

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Ownable: new owner is the zero address"

nodes.documentation: @dev Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`).
nodes.name: _transferOwnership

nodes.documentation: @dev Returns the amount of tokens in existence.
nodes.name: totalSupply

nodes.documentation: @dev Returns the amount of tokens owned by `account`.
nodes.name: balanceOf
transfer

nodes.documentation:
@dev Returns the remaining number of tokens that `spender` will be
allowed to spend on behalf of `owner` through {transferFrom}. This is
zero by default.
     * This value changes when {approve} or {transferFrom} are called.
nodes.name: allowance

nodes.documentation:
@dev Sets `amount` as the allowance of `spender` over the caller's tokens.
     * Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded.
     * IMPORTANT: Beware that changing an allowance with this method brings the risk
that someone may use both the old and the new allowance by unfortunate
transaction ordering. One possible solution to mitigate this race
condition is to first reduce the spender's allowance to 0 and set the
desired value afterwards:
https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729
     * Emits an {Approval} event.
nodes.name: approve

nodes.documentation:
@dev Moves `amount` tokens from `sender` to `recipient` using the
allowance mechanism. `amount` is then deducted from the caller's
allowance.
     * Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded.
     * Emits a {Transfer} event.
nodes.name: transferFrom
Transfer

nodes.documentation:
@dev Emitted when the allowance of a `spender` for an `owner` is set by
a call to {approve}. `value` is the new allowance.
nodes.name: Approval

devdoc.author: Yogesh Singh
devdoc.details: Store, calculate, collect and transefer stakes and rewards to end user

addPool(address,address,uint256).details: This function will create new pool, access type is onlyOwner

params._reward: Staking reward token address for this pool
params._token: Staking token address for this pool.

addRewardToPool(uint256,uint256).details: This funciton allows owner to add more reward amount to  this contract.

params._poolId: pool's Id in which you want to add this reward.
params.amount: amount to be transfered from owner's wallet to this contract.

calculateReward(uint256,address).details: This function is used to calculate Total reward for stakeHolder for pool

params._poolId: The pool for which we want to calculate reward.
params._stakeHolder: The address of stakeHolder to calculate Total reward

claimReward(uint256).details: Calculate the current reward, add with previous reward, Transefer it to sender and update reward to 0

params._poolId: Pool from which user want to claim the reward.
The pool for which you want to get list of stakeHolders.

haveSuffecientFundsForReward(uint256).details: Function to check if contract have suffecient reward allowance or not

params._poolId: The pool for which you want to check reward availibility

haveSuffecientFundsForReward(uint256).return: True if have sufficient allowance for paying all the rewards

isOwner().details: Returns true if the caller is the current owner.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

poolLength().details: This funtion will return the length of pools\ which will be used to loop and get pool details.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.     * NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

stake(uint256,uint256).details: Allows user to stake the amount the pool. Calculate the old reward\ and updates the reward, staked amount and current APY.

params._poolId: The pool in which user wants to stake.
params.amount: The amount user wants to add into his stake.

totalReward(uint256).details: Calculate and return total undelivered rewards till now.

params._poolId: The pool for which you want to calculate total reward.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

unstake(uint256,uint256).details: Sum the unstakable amount delete and transfer the request to _stakeHolder

params._poolId: The pool in which user wants to unstake.
params.amount: The amount user wants to add into his stake

updateAPY(uint256,uint256).details: This function allows owner to update APY for specific pool.

params._poolId: pool's Id in which you want to update the APY.

devdoc.title: Staking contract

addPool(address,address,uint256).notice: This Function will create new pool with the token address,\ reward address and the APY percentage.

addRewardToPool(uint256,uint256).notice: Let's you allot more reward fund in this contract.

claimReward(uint256).notice: This function will transfer the reward earned till now.

getStakers(uint256).notice: This function will give list of stakers who have staked any amount.

haveSuffecientFundsForReward(uint256).notice: This function will return if it has sufficient fund for paying the reward

init().notice: This method will be called once only by proxy contract to init.

poolLength().notice: Get the length of pools and use it to loop for index.

stake(uint256,uint256).notice: This function will update your staked amount.

totalReward(uint256).notice: This function will give you total of unclaimed rewards till now.

unstake(uint256,uint256).notice: This function will transfer the unstable amount to your wallet

updateAPY(uint256,uint256).notice: Let's you update the APY for this pool if you're current owner.

userdoc.notice: This contract will store and manage staking at APY defined by owner
